posts.raw:
Hello everyone!

I am learning Typst and trying to move from LaTeX. Just a quick question about layout config. How can I define a double-sided document?

For reference, in LaTeX it is done with `\documentclass[twoside]{article}` or as default with the `book` class, but I couldn't figured it out with Typst and the `page` function.

Thanks.

posts.name: Vincent Martel
posts.cooked:
Hi @Btjk16, you can start by having a look at the Typst documentation:

  • Page setup guide - Alternating margins
  • Page setup guide - Different header and footer on specific pages

Typst Universe is a good place to find some examples. I particularly like Hydra.
posts.raw:
Hi @Btjk16, you can start by having a look at the Typst documentation:

- [Page setup guide - Different header and footer on specific pages](https://typst.app/docs/guides/page-setup-guide/#specific-pages)  

Typst Universe is a good place to find some examples. I particularly like [Hydra](https://typst.app/universe/package/hydra).
